metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12180 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in BlockIo service for EDK II may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege, information disclosure and/or denial of service via network access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12180` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ovmf - 0~20190606.20d2e5a1-1ubuntu2
qemu-efi - 0~20190606.20d2e5a1-1ubuntu2
qemu-efi-aarch64 - 0~20190606.20d2e5a1-1ubuntu2
qemu-efi-arm - 0~20190606.20d2e5a1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: edk2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0~20190606.20d2e5a1-1ubuntu2').
